intro: Oenanthe hookeri, commonly known as Hooker's water dropwort, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and forest floors. It has a slender, branched stem and produces small, round fruits. Oenanthe hookeri is often found in the South Island and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
